docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 11 -- Greece and Syria, as well as six LatinAmerican nations, were among purchasers of surplus United States munitions from stocks abroad, the State Department disclosed in a periodic report of its Foreign Liquidation Commissioner.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 11 -- Greece and Syria, as well as six LatinAmerican nations, were among purchasers of surplus United States munitions from stocks abroad, the State Department disclosed in a periodic report of its Foreign Liquidation Commissioner.

headline.main: GREECE AND SYRIA BUY U.S. MUNITIONS; 6 Latin-American Nations Also Got Surplus Arms at Low Cost, Report Reveals

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 13 -- The membership of the elevennation Special Committee set up to investigate the Palestine problem was examined carefully tonight by observers, and the verdict was that it was a fairly balanced group and a good approach to...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 13 -- The membership of the elevennation Special Committee set up to investigate the Palestine problem was examined carefully tonight by observers, and the verdict was that it was a fairly balanced group and a good approach to neutrality.
docs.abstract: Participates in UN session on Palestine

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 13 -- Plans to establish an elevenmember Committee of Inquiry into the Palestine question and instructions for the committee were approved today by the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 13 -- Plans to establish an elevenmember Committee of Inquiry into the Palestine question and instructions for the committee were approved today by the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly.
